ODBC Administrator

Introduction

The ODBC Administrator is an application which allows for the complete configuration of the ODBC system from a friendly Graphical User Interface (GUI). The principle tasks one can perform with the ODBC Administrator are;

  • register/deregister a driver
  • configure a driver
  • create/edit/remove Data Source Names
  • set Trace options
  • set Pooling options
  • set Threading options
  • monitor ODBC activity

The ODBC Administrator is depicted in "Figure 01". The appearance of the ODBC Administrator may vary slightly depending upon the desktop environment.

Figure 01

Running ODBC Administrator

There are a number of ways to run the ODBC Administrator.

 Command-line

The ODBC Administrator can be invoked from the command-line as follows;

$ ODBCManageDataSourcesQ4
Figure 02

An alternative is to invoke it using the odbcinst command-line tool as follows;

$ odbcinst -m
Figure 03

Desktop

You may find that the easiest way to run the ODBC Administrator is to find it within your desktop menu/icon system such as the KDE 'start' menu.
